meanings.sent1: The artist's generative mind led to beautiful paintings.
meanings.sent2: Her generative skills in pottery resulted in stunning vases.
meanings.sent3: The generative chef whipped up a magical dish with just a few ingredients.
meanings.sent4: His generative imagination painted the world in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The generative power of nature never ceases to amaze me.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to generate or bring about
meanings.sent1: The team's generative approach to problem-solving was effective.
meanings.sent2: His generative leadership style inspired others to excel.
meanings.sent3: The generative magician made the impossible seem possible.
meanings.sent4: Her generative influence sparked positive change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The generative force of teamwork propelled them to success.

meanings.sent1: The generative brainstorming session yielded innovative solutions.
meanings.sent2: His generative thinking revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent3: The generative comedian had the audience in stitches with his jokes.
meanings.sent4: Her generative approach to storytelling captivated readers worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The generative spark of creativity ignited a wave of inspiration.

meanings.sent1: The generative process allowed for easy duplication of the design.
meanings.sent2: The software had a generative feature for creating multiple copies.
meanings.sent3: The generative machine churned out identical parts effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: His generative ability to mimic voices was uncanny.
meanings.sent5: The generative nature of cells ensures growth and regeneration.
